page.title: 05Local Water Supply
page.content: Nearby on Sunderland Hill there is a concrete water tower. It can be seen for miles around.Water towers have to be very high so that pure water can be piped into our houses under pressure. Ravensden's water supply comes from Grafham Water.It is purified at Bedford Water Works.From there it is pumped to Ravensden water tower.The pumps work continuously to fill the tower.The level of the water in the tower varies at different times in the day.During the night demand is low and the level of water is high.Between 7a.m. and 9a.m. demand is high and the water level falls. It falls again in early evening when people return home. It is important not to waste water. A dripping tap can waste 20 to 40 litres of water daily.Our school bill is Â£201 for six months.
